title: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
OB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file gets dirtied even though no changes were made.
EB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file should remain unchanged and not get dirtied if no changes are made.
SR:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl+Space to trigger code assist.
